main_definition: Neo refers to something new or revived, often associated with a modern version of an older concept or system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a new period in history, typically the present one after ancient times and before the modern age (post-classical era).
meanings_and_examples.example: The neo Renaissance art movement combined elements of classical Renaissance art with contemporary ideas.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to a revival or renewed interest in something, especially from an earlier time.
meanings_and_examples.example: Neo-Gothic architecture refers to the 19th-century revival of Gothic architectural elements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a new form or technology that is considered superior to its predecessor, especially in science and industry.
meanings_and_examples.example: Neo-Luddism refers to the modern critique of advanced technologies, emphasizing the need for balance between progress and human wellbeing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as a prefix or suffix indicating something new or novel in its field.
meanings_and_examples.example: Neo-capitalism is an economic system where traditional capitalism principles are modified to adapt to the modern world.
